content:
‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: That's cool !

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I like it

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun to parse a lot of input data to make it useable. Good use of comments!

'Greek: e√Æs, d√∫o, tre√Æs, t√©ssares, p√©nte, hex, hept√°, okt√≥, enn√©a, d√©ka'

That is Ancient Greek, so I'd suggest to either rename it or change it to this:

-> √©na, d√∫o, tr√≠a, t√©ssera, p√©nte, √©xi, ept√°, okt√≥, enn√©a, d√©ka
without accents because of the non-ascii issue:
-> ena, duo, tria, tessera, pente, exi, epta, okto, ennea, deka

Also Spanish: seite -> siete

Nice use of the stub, TIL you could do that.

Input section
* Please add "all separated by a space".

Output section
* Please add "all separated by a space".

Cases
Non-ASCII characters are not handled correctly in the error messages in CG's console. I would suggest to exclude the numbers which contain those characters from the input.
 (P.S. 1: Yeah, it is difficult to imagine how one manages to make an error with those characters. But a newbie can make any unimaginable mistake. Even when they don't, they may still be confused by what they see.)
(P.S. 2: I hope CG can fix that soon. https://www.codingame.com/forum/t/emojis-and-other-unusual-unicode-symbols-unsupported-in-stderr/201033 )

Thanks.

Thanks as always.  I have made some changes to address the issues.

Would you please review all again, and let me know.

Thanks.  Surprisingly I dont actually speak all those languages, so I just got it off a web site.

I‚Äôm going to revise based on yours and 5D‚Äôs comments.

I think I‚Äôm going to leave all the accents and stuff in, and just have the answer be the answer instead of the equation plus the answer‚Ä¶. I‚Äôll let you and 5D know when it‚Äôs revised so you can check again hopefully

More neato stub tricks are here if interested:

covered in the last section of https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/stub-generator, along with INPUT and OUTPUT.

Thanks Rafarafa --
I made multiple changes, including adding Modern Greek. :)

Please review the whole thing entirely again, if you don't mind.

Also, I "credited" you in the statement.  I hope that is ok.

Haha, thank you but I don't think it was necessary. I just happened to notice those while looking at the stub magic.

I already upvoted this clash before because I liked the stub usage, it seems now that you also managed to fix the non-ascii thingy, that's great.

I solved it in ruby, everything fine on my side.

I don't know how I feel about the Shortest mode, but maybe it's just fine.

I also tested for a bit how many words did you end up using, to see if I could sneak some tricks in Shortest but everything seems to appear at least once, that's nice too.

Thanks :)

Thanks for the thorough test-drive and kicking the tires.

I had created a program to randomly generate all the test cases, so I'm glad the magic-of-random did its job and used them all.

Ah, your way of excluding those accented characters from output instead of input is even better!

I also think it's a good idea to include the numbering in output because that makes debugging (identifying which one goes wrong) easier than before.

Well done!

Hi 5DN1L - I'm working on another (unrelated) puzzle.... and have a question for you....

if I have (for example) üêØüòºü•èüêÄ as my input and just a number as my output, will that cause any problems ???

I don't know ALL programming languages well enough to answer your question. ASSUMING there's no problem in reading the input, the only issue I know is with the console having an issue to show them in the error/debug messages. And in your case, I'd imagine that unless the player prints those characters as part of the debug messages, there should be no problem.
